isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Power Cylinders - Clean, Inspect, and Test - Connecting Rods

step1.para: Inspect connecting rod bolts for nicks or damage.
Inspect rod and cap mating surfaces for fretting. Replace as required.
With connecting rod cap removed, inspect surface finish of connecting rod bearing bore. Bore must be smooth and free of scoring, nicks, or burrs. Replace as required.
Inspect connecting rod for twisting or a bent rod. Often engine component wear patterns can be identified and used to diagnose a problem. Some common examples of connecting rod wear patterns include:

item.para: A shiny surface on edge of piston pin bushing usually indicates that a connecting rod is bent or piston pin hole is not in proper relation to piston skirt and ring grooves.
Abnormal connecting rod bearing wear can be caused by either a bent connecting rod or a tapered connecting rod bore.

Slightly twisted connecting rods will not create an easily identifiable wear pattern but badly twisted rods will disturb action of entire piston, rings, and connecting rod assembly and may be a cause of excessive oil consumption.

step1.para: If any of these conditions exist, check connecting rods for bends or twists using a suitable alignment fixture. Follow instructions of fixture manufacturer.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage when servicing, do not mix forged connecting rods with fractured connecting rods in the same engine. Weights of connecting rods are different and will cause engine vibration if mixed.

note.para: If connecting rod is bent or twisted, replace entire connecting rod assembly. If connecting rods do not meet " Specification " for connecting rod measurements, replace entire connecting rod assembly.

svcsubproc.title: Assemble Fractured Connecting Rods

caution.para: To avoid engine damage when servicing, do not mix forged connecting rods with fractured connecting rods in the same engine. Weights of connecting rods are different and will cause engine vibration if mixed.

To avoid engine damage, keep the fractured mating surfaces clean and free of lint and debris. Do not allow the mating surfaces to rest on any surface. Do not bump the mating surfaces or drop connecting rod or cap. This could cause chipping and wear on mating surface, resulting in improper mating during installation and possible engine damage.

To avoid engine damage, if rod cap is reversed when assembled to connecting rod or a rod cap is not installed on its original matching connecting rod, fractured mating surfaces will be permanently damaged. This may cause rod cap to come loose. Entire connecting rod must be replaced.

table.title: Specification Changes for Fractured Connecting Rod Assembly

step1.para: Keep each cap with its respective rod. Match serial numbers on side of each rod and cap.

note.para: Fractured mating surfaces of each rod and cap pair are precisely matched.

svcsubproc.para: Rod cap can only be correctly installed on connecting rod if it is oriented in correct direction. If rod cap is reversed during assembly of connecting rod, an offset will be seen at mating surfaces. If connecting rod assembly is installed on crankshaft in this manner, connecting rod must be replaced. Also, check crank pin fillets for damage. Such damage will require replacement of the crankshaft.
Each rod cap has an arrow for correct orientation in engine during installation. Arrow must point toward front of engine.

step1.para: Measure connecting rod piston pin bushing at two locations 90° apart, with Telescoping Gauge Set (OEM1022) and Outside Micrometer.

figure.caption: Measure connecting rod piston pin bore

step1.para: If piston pin bushing measurement exceeds " Specification ," replace entire connecting rod assembly.

svcsubproc.title: Measure Connecting Rod Bore for Out-of-Round

step1.para: Lubricate connecting rod bolts with clean engine oil and assemble cap to rod without bearing insert. Insert rod bolts fully by hand. Tighten bolts to " Special Torque ."

note.para: When lubricated with clean engine oil, bolts must screw in rod by hand. If resistance is met, clean rod threads and retry, or try a new bolt. If a new bolt does not screw in freely, rod must be discarded. Rod threads cannot be re-tapped.

step1.para: Measure connecting rod in three locations, with a Telescoping Gauge Set (OEM1022) and Outside Micrometer or an Inside Micrometer .
If difference between point "B" and average of points "A" and "C" "([A + C] ÷ 2)" exceeds " Specifications ," entire connecting rod assembly must be replaced.

svcsubproc.title: Measure Connecting Rod Bearing Bore Taper

step1.para: Measure connecting rod bearing bore inside diameter on each side of bearing bore, with a Telescoping Gauge Set (OEM1022) and Outside Micrometer or an Inside Micrometer .

figure.caption: Measure connecting rod bearing bore taper

step1.para: If difference between two measurements (bore taper) exceeds " Specifications ," entire connecting rod assembly must be replaced.
